plugins.name: Figma Page Generator
plugins.description:
Meet Figma Page Generator


Streamline your Figma workflow by quickly creating multiple pages at once. This plugin allows you to easily set up your project structure without the tedious process of creating pages one by one.


Key features:

  1. Create multiple pages simultaneously by entering page names
  2. Insert divider pages to organize your file structure
  3. Automatically create a default frame for each new page
  4. Choose from predefined templates for common project types


Whether you're starting a new design project or reorganizing an existing one, Figma Page Generator helps you maintain a consistent and efficient page structure. Enter your desired page names, and let the plugin do the work for you.

Get started quickly:


  1. Enter page names, one per line
  2. Use '——————' to add divider pages
  3. Click 'Generate Pages' to create your structure


Boost your productivity and keep your Figma files organized with Figma Page Generator!


Created with 💖 by Himanshu Raikwar
plugins.tagline: Transform Your Workflow: Pages Perfected in a Click

plugins.name: Data Generator: address and network information
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to generate real addresses from all over the world and automatically update text layers with generated data.


1) Select text layers in your figma file

2) Run the plugin and start entering keywords for the desired addresses.


Supports any language. For example: Italy Milan Street, or 北京万豪, or سوق الشارع. Data in text layers is updated automatically while you are typing keywords.


I originally used this plugin to test the adaptive layout of my mockups in real time. So maybe this is the best way for you to use this plugin.

plugins.name: uibowl
plugins.description:
유아이볼의 이미지를 피그마로 더욱 간편하게 가져오세요!

*피그마 데스크탑 앱에서만 사용 가능합니다.

유아이볼 링크 : https://uibowl.io/


[이용방법]

'uibowl 웹사이트'에서

1. 원하는 이미지에 마우스를 호버해 체크박스를 선택하세요.

2. 하단에 나타나는 ‘내보내기’ 버튼을 통해 이미지를 피그마로 내보내세요.


'피그마'로 이동해서

1. 플러그인을 실행해 ‘플러그인 창’을 클릭해주세요.

2. ⌘ V를 눌러주시면 불러오기 완료!


-

Export Uibowl’s reference images into Figma with ease!

*Only available in the Figma desktop app.


On the uibowll website:

1. Hover over the desired image and select the checkbox.

2. Use the "Export" button at the bottom to send the images to Figma.


In Figma:

1. Launch the plugin and click the "Plugin Window."

2. Press ⌘ V to complete the import!


Get your references directly from Uibowl now!
plugins.tagline: Export uibowl's UI reference images into Figma

plugins.name: Codia AI Canva: Import Canva Designs to Editable Figma
plugins.description:
Simplify Your Design Workflow with the Canva to Editable Figma Plugin——The ideal solution for quickly converting your Canva files into fully editable Figma layers. This tool enhances efficiency, precision, and security when transitioning from Canva to Figma.


Key Features and Advantages


Fast Conversion

Instantly import your Canva document into Figma with minimal loading times, speeding up your design process without sacrificing quality.


Fully Editable Layers

Every element from your Canva document is converted into fully editable layers in Figma, ensuring you have complete control over adjustments and iterations.


High Compatibility & Perfect Conversion

Enjoy seamless compatibility between Canva and Figma. The plugin ensures that all your design elements, including fonts, effects, and layer structures, are perfectly preserved during the transition.


Privacy Protection

Your files are handled securely throughout the import process, ensuring that your designs remain private and protected.


Streamline Your Design Process

Using the Canva to Editable Figma Plugin will revolutionize your workflow, saving you valuable time and effort. Instead of manually recreating designs in Figma or struggling with compatibility issues, this plugin automates the process, delivering pixel-perfect conversions with full layer editability.


Whether you’re part of a team collaborating on projects or working solo, the ability to instantly convert Canva document ensures smoother design handoffs and iterations. With fast, accurate, and secure file conversions, you can focus more on creativity and collaboration, knowing your designs are perfectly preserved across platforms.


Call to Action☎️

For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI

accepted.name: Codia.AI
accepted.description: Anything to Design, Anything to Code.

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly bring your Canva designs into Figma

plugins.name: Scale Command
plugins.description:
Scale layers with Quick Actions Search Bar (⌘+/)


With Scale Command you can do these:

  1. The fastest way to scale images to 50%, trigger this plugin with custom shortcut and press "Enter", done!
  2. Just input 24w or 75, you can quickly and accurately scale images to 24 pixels width or 75% overall.
  3. Scale images from any origin point you want.


How to use

  1. Install this plugin and select one or more layers in Figma/Figjam.
  2. Open quick actions search bar (follow this article).
  3. Input scc in the search bar, you will see the Scale Command> ⊡ Center command and other commands in the suggestions list.
  4. Select the origin point you want to use from the suggested list, or continue typing the keyword you need, eg scctl will display the Scale Command> ╒ Top Left command, press "Enter" or "Tab" to use the command.
  5. In the scale parameter input box, you can enter a width, a height, a percentage or a multiple, then press "Enter" to scale.


Scaling Syntax

  • Scale to specified width: w + width number (or + w suffix). eg w24, w512, 24w, 512w
  • Scale to specified height: h + height number (or + h suffix). eg h24, h512, 24h, 512h
  • Scale by percentage: percentage figures. eg 200 (equals 200%) , 75(equals 75%)
  • Scale by multiple: multiple number + x. eg 2x, 0.75x


Tips

  1. Set a shortcut for Plugins->Scale Command->⊡ Center command, recommended use Command + Shift + S
  2. After input any number, you can use the arrow keys to select suggested values.



Origin points in plugin command

If you want to set a shortcut to a command, you can copy the command name below.

⊡ Center
╒ Top Left
╤ Top Middle
╕ Top Right
╞ Middle Left
╡ Middle Right
╘ Bottom Left
╧ Bottom Middle
╝ Bottom Right

plugins.name: Brand Guardian
plugins.description:
Brand Guardian is an AI driven platform that gives marketing, creative and production teams total content quality assurance at scale. This plugin connects Figma with Brand Guardian platform to enable a review process that will ensure the designs are on brand, inclusive and compliant.


To use this plugin you need a Brand Guardian account. If you’re interested but don’t have one yet, please contact us at obg@wundermanthompson.com.


How does it work? 

  1. Log into your Brand Guardian account. 
  2. Select part of the design you want to review. 
  3. Choose the Brand and Rule Collection for the design. 
  4. Submit the asset and wait for feedback. 


Contact information 

Email: obg@wundermanthompson.com 

Website: https://www.wundermanthompson.com/brand-guardian

plugins.name: NFTIZ
plugins.description:
NFTIZ is a Figma plugin that enables you to transform your design into a NFT. With NFTIZ, it's super easy to turn your Figma creations into NFT, put them on sale on OpenSea or send them as gifts to your friends.  


How to transform your design into NFT with NFTIZ?

  1. Open the NFTIZ plugin
  2. Select the frame you want to mint
  3. Fulfill the form with a name, a description and the Ethereum address where you want to receive your NFT ⇒ Click on "Mint"

Easy as 1,2,3...


https://nftiz-app.xyz/

plugins.name: Rapid Insert
plugins.description:
Rapid Insert is a Figma plugin that simplifies the prototyping process by allowing users to quickly search for and clone components from other pages within the same file and insert them directly onto the current page. This eliminates the need to manually copy and paste components, saving time and increasing efficiency in the design process. Rapid Insert is intuitive and easy to use, making it the perfect tool for streamlining your workflow and boosting productivity.


Using Rapid Insert is simple:

  1. Open the Rapid Insert plugin by going to the "Plugins" menu in Figma and selecting "Rapid Insert."
  2. Select the source page from where you want to clone the component.
  3. Type in a search query or navigate through the components.
  4. Once you have found the desired component, hit enter to insert it directly onto the current page.
  5. Repeat as needed to quickly prototype your design.


You can also use the keyboard shortcuts to quickly access the plugin, navigate through the components and select them.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert components and named layers for lightning-fast prototyping.

plugins.name: 批量修改字体字号 Batch Font Size Modifier
plugins.description:
帮助你高效批量调整文本图层的 字体、字号 和 字重。无论是统一设计风格，还是快速适配项目需求，这款插件都能让你的文本管理更加简单快捷。


主要功能

批量改字体：快速更改选定文本图层的字体，支持所有已加载的字体库。

批量改字号：随时调整字体大小，一键应用到多个文本图层。

批量改字重：为了更准确的修改，需手动粘贴字重（例如 Regular、Bold、Medium 等）


适用需要统一文本样式的大型设计项目。

快速调整不同状态的字体权重（例如标题、正文和按钮样式）。


使用步骤

在 Figma 中选择一个或多个 Frame。

打开插件，插件会自动识别选定 Frame 中的所有文本图层。

根据需要修改字体、字号和字重，点击“应用更改”。

所有设置将批量更新到选定的文本图层中。

O DAI é um produto de um Trabalho de Conclusão de Curso (TCC) do curso de Design Digital na Universidade Federal do Ceará Campus em Quixadá. O trabalho foi construído pelo aluno George Moreno de Oliveira orientado pela professora doutora Ingrid Teixeira Monteiro, professora da UFC e pesquisadora na área da Interação Humano-computador.


O trabalho intitulado "Desenvolvimento de um plugin para documentação de acessibilidade para interfaces no Figma" está atualmente na fase de desenvolvimento do produto, o plugin, que pode ser utilizado clonando o seguinte repositório.

plugins.name: Text to Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create sticky notes from any text-based elements on your FigJam board. Transform table content, selected text, shapes with text, or existing sticky notes into a neatly organized collection of sticky notes in just a few clicks. Perfect for brainstorming and organizing ideas.


Features:

  1. Create sticky notes in bulk.
  2. Seamlessly transform table content into sticky notes, extracting each cell’s text and organizing it row by row.
  3. Generate sticky notes from selected text, shapes with text, or existing sticky notes on your FigJam board.
  4. Arrange sticky notes either horizontally or vertically, maintaining consistent spacing for a clean, organized look.
  5. View and modify text from selected objects directly in the plugin’s input field.


How to Use

  1. Type your notes into the textfield, one note per line or select text, shapes, stickies, or tables to auto-fill the input field with their content..
  2. Select horizontal or vertical alignment for your sticky notes.
  3. Click "Create Notes" to instantly add them to your board.
plugins.tagline: Create sticky notes from inputted text, tables, or objects seamlessly in FigJam!

plugins.name: Edit in place
plugins.description:
This plugin enables you to select any instance of a local component (not from a library) and edit the master component in place from the context of wherever you are using the instance. This is handy if your master components are on another page!

How it works
1. Select an instance of a local component 

2. Run 'Edit in place' (If you have selected a component from a library, the plugin will tell you).

3. The plugin will hide your instance and move your master in the context of your design so that you can edit it.

4. When you press done, or close the plugin UI, the instance will return and yout master component will remain at its previous location in the document.

plugins.name: Conditioner
plugins.description:
• Show how components in your design should look under different application conditions.

• Update all instances to depict a different application-wide condition in one click.

INSTRUCTIONS
===

Follow these instructions to make any component swappable using Conditioner.

1. Create a new component, or choose an existing component, and move it out of any parent frames so its frame is at the top level of the document, not embedded inside any other frames.

2. Name the component anything you'd like, but make sure it ends with " ? " followed by the name of the condition it represents. Example: "Header ? Anonymous" or "Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Anonymous"

3. Place instances of the component into any places within your design you'd like it to appear.

4. Create a new conditional variation, also at the top level within the page. You can do this by duplicating the original component and changing overrides, or you can make a completely new frame with completely different content. Make the new instance or frame into a component, and name it to match the first conditional variation. Example: "Header ? Logged-in" or "Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Logged-in"

5. Repeat step 4 for as many conditional variations you'd like to make for this component.

6. Wrap all the conditional variations together in one frame. Name the frame using the component name, followed by " ?" at the end. Example: "Header ?" or "Navigation / Bottom Tabs ?"

Repeat the process to set up as many conditionally-swappable components as you need. Run the Conditioner plugin whenever you want to swap all the conditional instances in your design from one variation to another.

EXAMPLE LAYER STRUCTURE
===

Setting up conditional components:
---
FRAME: Header ?
- COMPONENT: Header ? Anonymous
- COMPONENT: Header ? Logged-in

FRAME: Navigation / Bottom Tabs ?
- COMPONENT: Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Anonymous
- COMPONENT: Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Logged-in

Using conditional instances in your designs:
---
FRAME: Home
- INSTANCE: Header ? Anonymous
- (other content)
- INSTANCE: Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Anonymous

FRAME: Notifications
- INSTANCE: Header ? Anonymous
- (other content)
- INSTANCE: Navigation / Bottom Tabs ? Anonymous

plugins.name: Text United for Figma
plugins.description:
Translate prototypes and designs


Design a product, website, or prototype to international audiences without the hassle. With the Text United plugin, you will be able to translate the content from your Figma design and see how your prototype will look like when localized into any language. 


What is Text United?


An end-to-end translation platform that allows marketers, designers, project managers, and developers to work collaboratively and to provide multilingual digital content and products faster and effortlessly.


With the Figma plugin, you can

  • Extract all the text from your Figma Design 
  • Machine translate instantly 
  • Create a translation project for translators from your own team 
  • Translate yourself 
  • Order professional translation service 
  • Insert translations into your design quickly, replacing the source text 


This plugin requires an active Text United paid account (14-Day Free Trial >>)


To use the plugin, you need to

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Copy the company ID number and API key from your Text United account and paste it into the plugin settings.
  3. Select how to translate: (machine translation, outsource to Text United, or you and your team) <- not a must to add.
  4. Choose the source language of your design and select a target language.
  5. Choose how to translate: Machine Translation can be applied to the design right away. For the Me-and-My team and Professional Service projects, the translation project will need to be completed first before inserting the translations into the design. 


Once the translation is completed, you can open My Project and click on Apply Translation.


You can also find the information, including screenshots, here

plugins.name: Segmentify
plugins.description:
AI Segment Image Fast.


A free Figma Plugin, Instantly extract elements from images into your Figma, boosting design efficiency and unleashing creative potential.


The plugin works by first extracting image embeddings using the SAM model. Then, users can add positive (foreground) and negative (background) points on the image to guide the segmentation process. The plugin then generates a mask based on these points and displays the segmented result in real-time.


Feel free to leave feedback and discuss in the comments section; I will continue to update and optimize the plugin.


For more information about the plugin, please visit the official website at https://segmentify.app/
plugins.tagline: AI Segment Image Fast,boosting design efficiency and unleashing creative potential.

plugins.name: Layerbeam
plugins.description:
The fastest way to test spatial UI designs in VR


What can you do with Layerbeam?


🎨 Design for spatial computing platforms

  • Use familiar tools to design panel-based spatial computing apps
  • Test designs in a virtual environment or your own space using passthrough AR mode


⭐️️️️ Run Figma prototypes in Virtual Reality

  • Create clickable prototypes of Vision Pro apps, Quest Augments and XR game UIs
  • Use hands to navigate your prototype app design and reposition it in the world around you
  • *Requires Pro subscription


🛜 Pair your VR headset with ease

  • Pair with a simple 6 digit code, no need to sign in to anything in VR
  • Layerbeam forms a direct connection between computer and headset over Wi-Fi
  • WebXR-compatible headsets are supported including all Quest versions


➡️ Getting Started with Layerbeam (Figma Community)

➡️ LinkedIn

➡️ Website

plugins.name: Figarc - Calculate physical spaces
plugins.description:
If you are like me, and you like to “misuse” Figma by drawing floor plans, then this plugin might be helpful to you.


The Figarc plugin helps you calculate physical spaces in Imperial (cm) and Metric (inch) systems, so you can get a sense how big the spaces you are drawing are.


To make the most out of the plugin, don‘t forget to download the Figarc library, which will help you conceptualize floor plans inside Figma, and then use this plugin to measure the rooms you‘ll be designing.


**Instructions**

To measure a rectangle, select any layer or frame inside Figma and then click on “Calculate area”. Don‘t forget that yo can modify the measurement units (cm or inch) in the Settings tab.

accepted.name: Zlatko Najdenovski
accepted.description: Creating side projects to increase passive income before the apocalypse.

plugins.tagline: Calculate physical spaces

plugins.name: Automatin
plugins.description:
Automate your tasks with the Figma JavaScript library.


How to use it?

Just write your code as if you were coding a plugin, and click on "Run code".

You can find the documentation here: https://www.figma.com/plugin-docs/api/figma/.


Why?

Instead of creating a plugin for each small automation, you can now write it directly in Figma. This means that you no longer have to:

  • create a plugin from scratch, which can be redundant
  • download the Figma Desktop app (because to use the plugin online, the moderators have to give their permission)


The project is open-source. Find the code here: https://github.com/arthur-fontaine/automatin-for-figma/.

plugins.name: LILT <> Figma Connector
plugins.description:
Embed translation directly into your design canvas with the LILT <> Figma Connector. Prototype, iterate, and optimize designs in 100+ languages to reach customers around the world:

  1. Test design spacing, layout, and format across languages
  2. Design a UX optimized for multiple languages
  3. Create smooth, accessible experiences for all global users


What is LILT?

LILT is the complete AI solution for enterprise translation, empowering organizations to scale and optimize global content.


The LILT Platform combines advanced AI technology with a human quality guarantee, ensuring unparalleled accuracy, speed, and scale. Partner with LILT to improve translation quality, automate workflows, and scale the reach of your designs.


How it Works

The LILT <> Figma Connector integrates translation into your design workflow:


  1. Design in your base language.
  2. Iterate rapidly with Instant Translation. Select frames or layers in Figma and in a matter of clicks, LILT delivers an Instant Translation from your organization’s customized, brand-specific AI models. Instantly see how text reflows, identify potential UI breaks, and experiment across languages in real-time to ensure designs are market-ready.
  3. Request publication-ready Verified Translation. For high-impact global designs, send content to LILT for quality-guaranteed translation with verification by skilled linguists.
  4. Receive and finalize in Figma. Localized content is delivered directly into your Figma file, preserving your design structure. Review across languages and publish.


Key Features & Benefits

  1. Flexible translation workflows: Choose Instant Translation for rapid prototyping or Verified Translation for final production, supporting the full design lifecycle.
  2. Accelerate time-to-market: LILT’s AI shortens delivery timelines, so you can ship global-ready designs faster.
  3. Seamless integration: Streamlined workflows and automation accelerate translation and enhance global team collaboration.
  4. Consistent global branding: LLMs are customized for your unique brand voice, ensuring consistency across all published languages.
  5. Effortless enterprise scalability: Easily translate large content volumes across 100+ languages, all within your Figma instance.


Getting Started with LILT in Figma

  1. Install: In Figma, navigate to Community > Plugins, choose LILT, and click Install.
  2. Configure: Launch the LILT plugin and navigate to Settings.
  3. Authenticate: Enter your LILT token and click “Save settings”.
  4. Design: Once configured, you are ready to send content to LILT for translation.


To use this plugin, your company must be a LILT customer.


Learn More & Support

  1. Discover how LILT empowers creative and technical teams at www.lilt.com.
  2. For more information about the LILT <> Figma Connector, visit the LILT Knowledge Base.
  3. For questions, a live demo, or to discuss how AI can be part of your global design strategy, email connect@lilt.com.

accepted.name: LILT
accepted.description: Quickly design and iterate across languages

plugins.tagline: Seamless enterprise-grade translation

plugins.name: Color Easily - Palette Generator
plugins.description:
Import Your Color Easily Palettes into Figma in 5 Easy Steps:

  1. Discover your new favorite color palette on coloreasily.com.
  2. Click the "Copy Link" button on the toolbar or simply copy the URL when you've found a palette you love.
  3. Paste the link into the plugin's URL input field.
  4. Click the "Generate" button.
  5. Get your Color Easily Palette and corresponding color styles imported into the project!


Features:

  • Your color palette will be displayed within an organized frame
  • Corresponding color styles will be automatically generated for each of the colors in your palette. The color styles will be named as 'text', 'background', 'accent 1', 'accent 2', 'accent 3' etc.
  • You can toggle whether you would like to update your current color styles, so you don't have to manually re-apply the new colors, or if you'd prefer to generate new color styles (default).


If you have any feature suggestions, feedback, or are experiencing any issues, let me know in the comments!
plugins.tagline: Import Your Color Easily Palettes into Figma

plugins.name: Design QA: Identify, Annotate and Track
plugins.description:
Identify and annotate bugs for your Design QA using our custom annotations, and track all the bugs in one place with our bug tracker table. Save time and effort while keeping track of your raised bugs in a single location.


How to Use:

  1. Create a frame or rectangle over the section of the screenshot or Figma design you wish to annotate.
  2. Keep the frame or rectangle selected.
  3. Run the plugin.
  4. Enter necessary information such as the page name where the bug was found, component, details of the discrepancy, expected behaviour, and direction for the annotation.
  5. You have multiple options:
  6. Choose between Design QA mode or Annotation mode. Note: Annotation mode does not create the QA tracker.
  7. In Design QA mode, you can choose to create a new table when starting a new QA round.
  8. You can opt to mark spacing that creates an arrow on the selected direction of the frame instead of creating an outline

Click 'Generate' and let the plugin do the work!


Tracking and Collaboration:

  1. Keep track of all bugs in the bug tracking table and share it with your engineering team for a comprehensive list of issues.


Note:

  1. Initial Use: The first time you run the plugin in Design QA mode, a tracker and status component is created. Subsequent annotations will add entries to this tracker. For annotation mode, a global counter is created. Please don't delete this node. We're using this node to keep track of number of bugs raised.
  2. Manual Adjustments: Some details, such as the points of contact for the project, design links, and browser details used during QA, will need to be manually updated.
  3. Edit with Ease: Undo and redo changes using standard cmd+z and cmd+shift+z. Ensure that entries in the tracker and annotations remain consistent. This might need multiple cmd+zs to bring it to a previous state.


We are committed to enhancing this tool to make it the ultimate companion for Design QA, continually adding features to simplify the QA process for designers. Please feel free to reach out for issues, suggestions and/or feature requests.

accepted.name: Headout Inc.
accepted.description: Creating innovative plugins and resources for the Figma community. Follow us for tools, insights, and design inspiration!

accepted.name: Mukul Chaturvedi
accepted.description: I am a Self-taught designer passionately in love with anything and everything related to designing.

plugins.tagline: Simplify design QAs with auto annotations and bug tracking
